trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting: Azure AD Password Management | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting: Azure AD Password Management | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Common troubleshooting steps for Azure AD Password Management, including reset, change, writeback, registration, and what information to include when looking for help.
trans-unit.target: Common troubleshooting steps for Azure AD Password Management, including reset, change, writeback, registration, and what information to include when looking for help.

trans-unit.source: How to troubleshoot Password Management
trans-unit.target: How to troubleshoot Password Management

trans-unit.source: If you are having issues with Password Management, we're here to help.
trans-unit.target: If you are having issues with Password Management, we're here to help.

trans-unit.source: Most problems you may run into can be solved with a few simple troubleshooting steps which you can read about below to troubleshoot your deployment:
trans-unit.target: Most problems you may run into can be solved with a few simple troubleshooting steps which you can read about below to troubleshoot your deployment:

trans-unit.source: Information to include when you need help
trans-unit.target: Information to include when you need help

trans-unit.source: Problems with Password Management configuration in the Azure Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Problems with Password Management configuration in the Azure Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Problems with Password Managment reports in the Azure Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Problems with Password Managment reports in the Azure Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Problems with the Password Reset Registration Portal
trans-unit.target: Problems with the Password Reset Registration Portal

trans-unit.source: Problems with the Password Reset Portal
trans-unit.target: Problems with the Password Reset Portal

trans-unit.source: Problems with Password Writeback
trans-unit.target: Problems with Password Writeback

trans-unit.source: Password Writeback event log error codes
trans-unit.target: Password Writeback event log error codes

trans-unit.source: Problems with Password Writeback connectivity
trans-unit.target: Problems with Password Writeback connectivity

trans-unit.source: If you've tried the troubleshooting steps below and are still running into problems, you can post a question on the [Azure AD Forums](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/forums/azure/home?forum=WindowsAzureAD) or contact support and we'll take a look at your problem as soon as we can.
trans-unit.target: If you've tried the troubleshooting steps below and are still running into problems, you can post a question on the [Azure AD Forums](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/forums/azure/home?forum=WindowsAzureAD) or contact support and we'll take a look at your problem as soon as we can.

trans-unit.source: Information to include when you need help
trans-unit.target: Information to include when you need help

trans-unit.source: If you cannot solve your issue with the guidance below, you can contact our support engineers.
trans-unit.target: If you cannot solve your issue with the guidance below, you can contact our support engineers.

trans-unit.source: When you contact them, it is recommended to include the following information:
trans-unit.target: When you contact them, it is recommended to include the following information:

trans-unit.source: **General description of the error** – what exact error message did the user see?
trans-unit.target: **General description of the error** – what exact error message did the user see?

trans-unit.source: If there was no error message, describe the unexpected behavior you noticed, in detail.
trans-unit.target: If there was no error message, describe the unexpected behavior you noticed, in detail.

trans-unit.source: **Page** – what page were you on when you saw the error (include the URL)?
trans-unit.target: **Page** – what page were you on when you saw the error (include the URL)?

trans-unit.source: **Date / Time / Timezone** – what was the precise date and time you saw the error (include the timezone)?
trans-unit.target: **Date / Time / Timezone** – what was the precise date and time you saw the error (include the timezone)?

trans-unit.source: **Support Code** – what was the support code generated when the user saw the error (to find this, reproduce the error, then click the Support Code link at the bottom of the screen and send the support engineer the GUID that results).
trans-unit.target: **Support Code** – what was the support code generated when the user saw the error (to find this, reproduce the error, then click the Support Code link at the bottom of the screen and send the support engineer the GUID that results).

trans-unit.source: If you are on a page without a support code at the bottom, press F12 and search for SID and CID and send those two results to the support engineer.
trans-unit.target: If you are on a page without a support code at the bottom, press F12 and search for SID and CID and send those two results to the support engineer.

trans-unit.source: **User ID** – what was the ID of the user who saw the error (e.g. user@contoso.com)?
trans-unit.target: **User ID** – what was the ID of the user who saw the error (e.g. user@contoso.com)?

trans-unit.source: **Information about the user** – was the user federated, password hash synced, cloud only?
trans-unit.target: **Information about the user** – was the user federated, password hash synced, cloud only?

trans-unit.source: Did the user have an AAD Premium or AAD Basic license assigned?
trans-unit.target: Did the user have an AAD Premium or AAD Basic license assigned?

trans-unit.source: **Application Event Log** – if you are using Password Writeback and the error is in your on-premises infrastructure, please zip up a copy of your application event log from your Azure AD Connect server and send along with your request.
trans-unit.target: **Application Event Log** – if you are using Password Writeback and the error is in your on-premises infrastructure, please zip up a copy of your application event log from your Azure AD Connect server and send along with your request.

trans-unit.source: Including this information will help us to solve your problem as quickly as possible.
trans-unit.target: Including this information will help us to solve your problem as quickly as possible.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot password reset configuration in the Azure Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot password reset configuration in the Azure Management Portal

trans-unit.source: If you encounter an error when configuring password reset, you might be able to resolve it by following the troubleshooting steps below:
trans-unit.target: If you encounter an error when configuring password reset, you might be able to resolve it by following the troubleshooting steps below:

trans-unit.source: Error Case
trans-unit.target: Error Case

trans-unit.source: What error does a user see?
trans-unit.target: What error does a user see?

trans-unit.source: Solution
trans-unit.target: Solution

trans-unit.source: I don’t see the User Password Reset Policy section under the Configure tab in the Azure management portal
trans-unit.target: I don’t see the User Password Reset Policy section under the Configure tab in the Azure management portal

trans-unit.source: The User Password Reset Policy section is not visible on the Configure tab in the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: The User Password Reset Policy section is not visible on the Configure tab in the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: This can occur if you do not have an AAD Premium or AAD Basic license assigned to the admin performing this operation.
trans-unit.target: This can occur if you do not have an AAD Premium or AAD Basic license assigned to the admin performing this operation.

trans-unit.source: To rectify this, assign an AAD Premium or AAD Basic license to the admin account in question by navigating to the Licenses tab and try again.
trans-unit.target: To rectify this, assign an AAD Premium or AAD Basic license to the admin account in question by navigating to the Licenses tab and try again.

trans-unit.source: I don’t see any of the configuration options under the User Password Reset Policy section that are described in the documentation.
trans-unit.target: I don’t see any of the configuration options under the User Password Reset Policy section that are described in the documentation.

trans-unit.source: The User Password Reset Policy section is visible, but the only flag that appears under it is the Users Enabled for Password Reset flag.
trans-unit.target: The User Password Reset Policy section is visible, but the only flag that appears under it is the Users Enabled for Password Reset flag.

trans-unit.source: The rest of the UI will appear when you switch the Users Enabled for Password Reset flag to Yes.
trans-unit.target: The rest of the UI will appear when you switch the Users Enabled for Password Reset flag to Yes.

trans-unit.source: I don’t see a particular configuration option.
trans-unit.target: I don’t see a particular configuration option.

trans-unit.source: For example, I do not see the Number of days before a user must confirm their contact data option when I scroll through the User Password Reset Policy section (or other examples of the same issue).
trans-unit.target: For example, I do not see the Number of days before a user must confirm their contact data option when I scroll through the User Password Reset Policy section (or other examples of the same issue).

trans-unit.source: Many elements of UI are hidden until they are needed.
trans-unit.target: Many elements of UI are hidden until they are needed.

trans-unit.source: Try enabling all the options on the page if you want to see.
trans-unit.target: Try enabling all the options on the page if you want to see.

trans-unit.source: See Customizing User Password Reset Policy for more info about all of the controls that are available to you.
trans-unit.target: See Customizing User Password Reset Policy for more info about all of the controls that are available to you.

trans-unit.source: I don’t see the Write Back Passwords to On-Premises configuration option
trans-unit.target: I don’t see the Write Back Passwords to On-Premises configuration option

trans-unit.source: The Write Back Passwords to On-Premises option is not visible under the Configure tab in the Azure Management Portal
trans-unit.target: The Write Back Passwords to On-Premises option is not visible under the Configure tab in the Azure Management Portal

trans-unit.source: This option is only visible if you have downloaded Azure AD Connect and configured Password Writeback.
trans-unit.target: This option is only visible if you have downloaded Azure AD Connect and configured Password Writeback.

trans-unit.source: When you have done this, that option appears and allows you to enable or disable writeback from the cloud.
trans-unit.target: When you have done this, that option appears and allows you to enable or disable writeback from the cloud.

trans-unit.source: See How to enable/disable Password Writeback for more information on how to do this.
trans-unit.target: See How to enable/disable Password Writeback for more information on how to do this.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot password management reports in the Azure Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot password management reports in the Azure Management Portal

trans-unit.source: If you encounter an error when using the password management reports, you might be able to resolve it by following the troubleshooting steps below:
trans-unit.target: If you encounter an error when using the password management reports, you might be able to resolve it by following the troubleshooting steps below:

trans-unit.source: Error Case
trans-unit.target: Error Case

trans-unit.source: What error does a user see?
trans-unit.target: What error does a user see?

trans-unit.source: Solution
trans-unit.target: Solution

trans-unit.source: I don’t see any password management reports
trans-unit.target: I don’t see any password management reports

trans-unit.source: The Password reset activity and Password reset registration activity reports are not visible under the Activity Log reports in the Reports tab.
trans-unit.target: The Password reset activity and Password reset registration activity reports are not visible under the Activity Log reports in the Reports tab.

trans-unit.source: This can occur if you do not have an AAD Premium or AAD Basic license assigned to the admin performing this operation.
trans-unit.target: This can occur if you do not have an AAD Premium or AAD Basic license assigned to the admin performing this operation.

trans-unit.source: To rectify this, assign an AAD Premium or AAD Basic license to the admin account in question by navigating to the Licenses tab and try again.
trans-unit.target: To rectify this, assign an AAD Premium or AAD Basic license to the admin account in question by navigating to the Licenses tab and try again.

trans-unit.source: User registrations show multiple times
trans-unit.target: User registrations show multiple times

trans-unit.source: When a user registers alternate email, mobile phone, and security questions, they each show up as separate lines instead of a single line.
trans-unit.target: When a user registers alternate email, mobile phone, and security questions, they each show up as separate lines instead of a single line.

trans-unit.source: Currently, when a user registers, we cannot assume that they will register everything present on the registration page.
trans-unit.target: Currently, when a user registers, we cannot assume that they will register everything present on the registration page.

trans-unit.source: As a result, we currently log each individual piece of data that is registered as a separate event.
trans-unit.target: As a result, we currently log each individual piece of data that is registered as a separate event.

trans-unit.source: If you want to aggregate this data, you can download the report and open the data as a pivot table in excel to have more flexibility.
trans-unit.target: If you want to aggregate this data, you can download the report and open the data as a pivot table in excel to have more flexibility.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot the password reset registration portal
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot the password reset registration portal

trans-unit.source: If you encounter an error when registering a user for password reset, you might be able to resolve it by following the troubleshooting steps below:
trans-unit.target: If you encounter an error when registering a user for password reset, you might be able to resolve it by following the troubleshooting steps below:

trans-unit.source: Error Case
trans-unit.target: Error Case

trans-unit.source: What error does a user see?
trans-unit.target: What error does a user see?

trans-unit.source: Solution
trans-unit.target: Solution

trans-unit.source: Directory is not enabled for password reset
trans-unit.target: Directory is not enabled for password reset

trans-unit.source: Your administrator has not enabled you to use this feature.
trans-unit.target: Your administrator has not enabled you to use this feature.

trans-unit.source: Switch the Users Enabled for Password Reset flag to Yes and hit Save in the Azure Management Portal directory configuration tab.
trans-unit.target: Switch the Users Enabled for Password Reset flag to Yes and hit Save in the Azure Management Portal directory configuration tab.

trans-unit.source: You must have an Azure AD Premium or Basic License assigned to the admin performing this operation.
trans-unit.target: You must have an Azure AD Premium or Basic License assigned to the admin performing this operation.

trans-unit.source: User does not have an AAD Premium or AAD Basic license assigned
trans-unit.target: User does not have an AAD Premium or AAD Basic license assigned

trans-unit.source: Your administrator has not enabled you to use this feature.
trans-unit.target: Your administrator has not enabled you to use this feature.

trans-unit.source: Assign an Azure AD Premium or Azure AD Basic license to the user under the Licenses tab in the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Assign an Azure AD Premium or Azure AD Basic license to the user under the Licenses tab in the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: You must have an Azure AD Premium or Basic License assigned to the admin performing this operation.
trans-unit.target: You must have an Azure AD Premium or Basic License assigned to the admin performing this operation.

trans-unit.source: Error processing request
trans-unit.target: Error processing request

trans-unit.source: User sees an error that states:
trans-unit.target: User sees an error that states:

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot the password reset portal
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot the password reset portal

trans-unit.source: If you encounter an error when resetting a password for a user, you might be able to resolve it by following the troubleshooting steps below:
trans-unit.target: If you encounter an error when resetting a password for a user, you might be able to resolve it by following the troubleshooting steps below:

trans-unit.source: Error Case
trans-unit.target: Error Case

trans-unit.source: What error does a user see?
trans-unit.target: What error does a user see?

trans-unit.source: Solution
trans-unit.target: Solution

trans-unit.source: Directory is not enabled for password reset
trans-unit.target: Directory is not enabled for password reset

trans-unit.source: Your account is not enabled for password reset
trans-unit.target: Your account is not enabled for password reset

trans-unit.source: We're sorry, but your administrator has not set up your account for use with this service.
trans-unit.target: We're sorry, but your administrator has not set up your account for use with this service.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot Password Writeback
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot Password Writeback

trans-unit.source: If you encounter an error when enabling, disabling, or using Password Writeback, you might be able to resolve it by following the troubleshooting steps below:
trans-unit.target: If you encounter an error when enabling, disabling, or using Password Writeback, you might be able to resolve it by following the troubleshooting steps below:

trans-unit.source: Error Case
trans-unit.target: Error Case

trans-unit.source: What error does a user see?
trans-unit.target: What error does a user see?

trans-unit.source: Solution
trans-unit.target: Solution

trans-unit.source: General onboarding and startup failures
trans-unit.target: General onboarding and startup failures

trans-unit.source: Password reset service does not start on premises with error 6800 in the Azure AD Connect machine’s application event log.
trans-unit.target: Password reset service does not start on premises with error 6800 in the Azure AD Connect machine’s application event log.

trans-unit.source: Password Writeback event log error codes
trans-unit.target: Password Writeback event log error codes

trans-unit.source: A best practice when troubleshooting issues with Password Writeback is to inspect that Application Event Log on your Azure AD Connect machine.
trans-unit.target: A best practice when troubleshooting issues with Password Writeback is to inspect that Application Event Log on your Azure AD Connect machine.

trans-unit.source: This event log will contain events from two sources of interest for Password Writeback.
trans-unit.target: This event log will contain events from two sources of interest for Password Writeback.

trans-unit.source: The PasswordResetService source will describe operations and issues related to the operation of Password Writeback.
trans-unit.target: The PasswordResetService source will describe operations and issues related to the operation of Password Writeback.

trans-unit.source: The ADSync source will describe operations and issues related to setting passwords in your AD environment.
trans-unit.target: The ADSync source will describe operations and issues related to setting passwords in your AD environment.

trans-unit.source: Code
trans-unit.target: Code

trans-unit.source: Name / Message
trans-unit.target: Name / Message

trans-unit.source: Source
trans-unit.target: Source

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: BAIL: MMS(4924) 0x80230619 – “A restriction prevents the password from being changed to the current one specified.”
trans-unit.target: BAIL: MMS(4924) 0x80230619 – “A restriction prevents the password from being changed to the current one specified.”

trans-unit.source: ADSync
trans-unit.target: ADSync

trans-unit.source: This event occurs when the Password Writeback service attempts to set a password on your local directory which does not meet the password age, history, complexity, or filtering requirements of the domain.
trans-unit.target: This event occurs when the Password Writeback service attempts to set a password on your local directory which does not meet the password age, history, complexity, or filtering requirements of the domain.

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetStart
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetStart

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that the on-premises service detected a password reset request for a federated or password hash sync’d user originating from the cloud.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that the on-premises service detected a password reset request for a federated or password hash sync’d user originating from the cloud.

trans-unit.source: This event is the first event in every password reset writeback operation.
trans-unit.target: This event is the first event in every password reset writeback operation.

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetSuccess
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetSuccess

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that a user selected a new password during a password reset operation, we determined that this password meets corporate password requirements, and that password has been successfully written back to the local AD environment.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that a user selected a new password during a password reset operation, we determined that this password meets corporate password requirements, and that password has been successfully written back to the local AD environment.

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetFail
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetFail

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that a user selected a password, and that password arrived successfully to the on-premises environment, but when we attempted to set the password in the local AD environment, a failure occurred.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that a user selected a password, and that password arrived successfully to the on-premises environment, but when we attempted to set the password in the local AD environment, a failure occurred.

trans-unit.source: This can happen for several reasons:
trans-unit.target: This can happen for several reasons:

trans-unit.source: See Troubleshoot Password Writeback to learn more about what other situtions can cause this error.
trans-unit.target: See Troubleshoot Password Writeback to learn more about what other situtions can cause this error.

trans-unit.source: OnboardingEventStart
trans-unit.target: OnboardingEventStart

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event occurs if you enable Password Writeback with Azure AD Connect and indicates that we started onboarding your organization to the Password Writeback web service.
trans-unit.target: This event occurs if you enable Password Writeback with Azure AD Connect and indicates that we started onboarding your organization to the Password Writeback web service.

trans-unit.source: OnboardingEventSuccess
trans-unit.target: OnboardingEventSuccess

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates the onboarding process was successful and that Password Writeback capability is ready to use.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates the onboarding process was successful and that Password Writeback capability is ready to use.

trans-unit.source: ChangePasswordStart
trans-unit.target: ChangePasswordStart

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that the on-premises service detected a password change request for a federated or password hash sync’d user originating from the cloud.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that the on-premises service detected a password change request for a federated or password hash sync’d user originating from the cloud.

trans-unit.source: This event is the first event in every password change writeback operation.
trans-unit.target: This event is the first event in every password change writeback operation.

trans-unit.source: ChangePasswordSuccess
trans-unit.target: ChangePasswordSuccess

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that a user selected a new password during a password change operation, we determined that this password meets corporate password requirements, and that password has been successfully written back to the local AD environment.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that a user selected a new password during a password change operation, we determined that this password meets corporate password requirements, and that password has been successfully written back to the local AD environment.

trans-unit.source: ChangePasswordFail
trans-unit.target: ChangePasswordFail

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that a user selected a password, and that password arrived successfully to the on-premises environment, but when we attempted to set the password in the local AD environment, a failure occurred.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that a user selected a password, and that password arrived successfully to the on-premises environment, but when we attempted to set the password in the local AD environment, a failure occurred.

trans-unit.source: This can happen for several reasons:
trans-unit.target: This can happen for several reasons:

trans-unit.source: See Troubleshoot Password Writeback to learn more about what other situations can cause this error.
trans-unit.target: See Troubleshoot Password Writeback to learn more about what other situations can cause this error.

trans-unit.source: ResetUserPasswordByAdminStart
trans-unit.target: ResetUserPasswordByAdminStart

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: The on-premises service detected a password reset request for a federated or password hash sync’d user originating from the administrator on behalf of a user.
trans-unit.target: The on-premises service detected a password reset request for a federated or password hash sync’d user originating from the administrator on behalf of a user.

trans-unit.source: This event is the first event in every admin-initiated password reset writeback operation.
trans-unit.target: This event is the first event in every admin-initiated password reset writeback operation.

trans-unit.source: ResetUserPasswordByAdminSuccess
trans-unit.target: ResetUserPasswordByAdminSuccess

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: The admin selected a new password during an admin-initiated password reset operation, we determined that this password meets corporate password requirements, and that password has been successfully written back to the local AD environment.
trans-unit.target: The admin selected a new password during an admin-initiated password reset operation, we determined that this password meets corporate password requirements, and that password has been successfully written back to the local AD environment.

trans-unit.source: ResetUserPasswordByAdminFail
trans-unit.target: ResetUserPasswordByAdminFail

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: The admin selected a password on behalf of a user, and that password arrived successfully to the on-premises environment, but when we attempted to set the password in the local AD environment, a failure occurred.
trans-unit.target: The admin selected a password on behalf of a user, and that password arrived successfully to the on-premises environment, but when we attempted to set the password in the local AD environment, a failure occurred.

trans-unit.source: This can happen for several reasons:
trans-unit.target: This can happen for several reasons:

trans-unit.source: See Troubleshoot Password Writeback to learn more about what other situtions can cause this error.
trans-unit.target: See Troubleshoot Password Writeback to learn more about what other situtions can cause this error.

trans-unit.source: OffboardingEventStart
trans-unit.target: OffboardingEventStart

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event occurs if you disable Password Writeback with Azure AD Connect and indicates that we started offboarding your organization to the Password Writeback web service.
trans-unit.target: This event occurs if you disable Password Writeback with Azure AD Connect and indicates that we started offboarding your organization to the Password Writeback web service.

trans-unit.source: OffboardingEventSuccess
trans-unit.target: OffboardingEventSuccess

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates the offboarding process was successful and that Password Writeback capability has been successfully disabled.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates the offboarding process was successful and that Password Writeback capability has been successfully disabled.

trans-unit.source: OffboardingEventFail
trans-unit.target: OffboardingEventFail

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates the offboarding process was not successful.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates the offboarding process was not successful.

trans-unit.source: This could be due to a permissions error on the cloud or on-premises administrator account specified during configuration, or because you are attempting to use a federated cloud global administrator when disabling Password Writeback.
trans-unit.target: This could be due to a permissions error on the cloud or on-premises administrator account specified during configuration, or because you are attempting to use a federated cloud global administrator when disabling Password Writeback.

trans-unit.source: To fix this, check your administrative permissions and that you are not using any federated account while configuring the Password Writeback capability.
trans-unit.target: To fix this, check your administrative permissions and that you are not using any federated account while configuring the Password Writeback capability.

trans-unit.source: WriteBackServiceStarted
trans-unit.target: WriteBackServiceStarted

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that the Password Writeback service has started successfully and is ready to accept password management requests from the cloud.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that the Password Writeback service has started successfully and is ready to accept password management requests from the cloud.

trans-unit.source: WriteBackServiceStopped
trans-unit.target: WriteBackServiceStopped

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that the Password Writeback service has stopped and that any password management requests from the cloud will not be successful.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that the Password Writeback service has stopped and that any password management requests from the cloud will not be successful.

trans-unit.source: AuthTokenSuccess
trans-unit.target: AuthTokenSuccess

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that we successfully retrieved an authorization token for the global admin specified during Azure AD Connect setup in order to start the offboarding or onboarding process.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that we successfully retrieved an authorization token for the global admin specified during Azure AD Connect setup in order to start the offboarding or onboarding process.

trans-unit.source: KeyPairCreationSuccess
trans-unit.target: KeyPairCreationSuccess

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that we successfully created the password encryption key that will be used to encrypt passwords from the cloud to be sent to your on-premises environment.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that we successfully created the password encryption key that will be used to encrypt passwords from the cloud to be sent to your on-premises environment.

trans-unit.source: UnknownError
trans-unit.target: UnknownError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates an unknown error during a password management operation.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates an unknown error during a password management operation.

trans-unit.source: Look at the exception text in the event for more details.
trans-unit.target: Look at the exception text in the event for more details.

trans-unit.source: If you are having problems, try disabling and re-enabling Password Writeback.
trans-unit.target: If you are having problems, try disabling and re-enabling Password Writeback.

trans-unit.source: If this does not help, include a copy of your event log along with the tracking id specified insider to your support engineer.
trans-unit.target: If this does not help, include a copy of your event log along with the tracking id specified insider to your support engineer.

trans-unit.source: ServiceError
trans-unit.target: ServiceError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates there was an error connecting to the cloud password reset service, and generally occurs when the on-premises service was unable to connect to the password reset web service.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates there was an error connecting to the cloud password reset service, and generally occurs when the on-premises service was unable to connect to the password reset web service.

trans-unit.source: ServiceBusError
trans-unit.target: ServiceBusError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates there was an error connecting to your tenant’s service bus instance.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates there was an error connecting to your tenant’s service bus instance.

trans-unit.source: This could happen because you are blocking outbound connections in your on-premises environment.
trans-unit.target: This could happen because you are blocking outbound connections in your on-premises environment.

trans-unit.source: Check your firewall to ensure you allow connections over TCP 443 and to https://ssprsbprodncu-sb.accesscontrol.windows.net/, and try again.
trans-unit.target: Check your firewall to ensure you allow connections over TCP 443 and to https://ssprsbprodncu-sb.accesscontrol.windows.net/, and try again.

trans-unit.source: If you are still having problems, try disabling and re-enabling Password Writeback.
trans-unit.target: If you are still having problems, try disabling and re-enabling Password Writeback.

trans-unit.source: InPutValidationError
trans-unit.target: InPutValidationError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that the input passed to our web service API was invalid.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that the input passed to our web service API was invalid.

trans-unit.source: Try the operation again.
trans-unit.target: Try the operation again.

trans-unit.source: DecryptionError
trans-unit.target: DecryptionError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that there was an error decrypting the password that arrived from the cloud.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that there was an error decrypting the password that arrived from the cloud.

trans-unit.source: This could be because of a decryption key mismatch between the cloud service and your on-premises environment.
trans-unit.target: This could be because of a decryption key mismatch between the cloud service and your on-premises environment.

trans-unit.source: In order to resolve this, disable and re-enable Password Writeback in your on-premises environment.
trans-unit.target: In order to resolve this, disable and re-enable Password Writeback in your on-premises environment.

trans-unit.source: ConfigurationError
trans-unit.target: ConfigurationError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: During onboarding, we save tenant-specific information in a configuration file in your on-premises environment.
trans-unit.target: During onboarding, we save tenant-specific information in a configuration file in your on-premises environment.

trans-unit.source: This event indicates there was an error saving this file or that when the service was started there was an error reading the file.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates there was an error saving this file or that when the service was started there was an error reading the file.

trans-unit.source: To fix this issue, try disabling and re-enabling Password Writeback to force a re-write of this configuration file.
trans-unit.target: To fix this issue, try disabling and re-enabling Password Writeback to force a re-write of this configuration file.

trans-unit.source: EndPointConfigurationError
trans-unit.target: EndPointConfigurationError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: DEPRECATED – This event is not present in Azure AD Connect, only very early builds of DirSync which supported writeback.
trans-unit.target: DEPRECATED – This event is not present in Azure AD Connect, only very early builds of DirSync which supported writeback.

trans-unit.source: OnBoardingConfigUpdateError
trans-unit.target: OnBoardingConfigUpdateError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: During onboarding, we send data from the cloud to the on-premises password reset service.
trans-unit.target: During onboarding, we send data from the cloud to the on-premises password reset service.

trans-unit.source: That data is then written to an in-memory file before being sent to the sync service to store this information securely on disk.
trans-unit.target: That data is then written to an in-memory file before being sent to the sync service to store this information securely on disk.

trans-unit.source: This event indicates a problem with writing or updating that data in memory.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates a problem with writing or updating that data in memory.

trans-unit.source: To fix this issue, try disabling and re-enabling Password Writeback to force a re-write of this configuration.
trans-unit.target: To fix this issue, try disabling and re-enabling Password Writeback to force a re-write of this configuration.

trans-unit.source: ValidationError
trans-unit.target: ValidationError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates we received an invalid response from the password reset web service.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates we received an invalid response from the password reset web service.

trans-unit.source: To fix this issue, try disabling and re-enabling Password Writeback.
trans-unit.target: To fix this issue, try disabling and re-enabling Password Writeback.

trans-unit.source: AuthTokenError
trans-unit.target: AuthTokenError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that we could not get an authorization token for the global administrator account specified during Azure AD Connect setup.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that we could not get an authorization token for the global administrator account specified during Azure AD Connect setup.

trans-unit.source: This error can be caused by a bad username or password specified for the global admin account or because the global admin account specified is federated.
trans-unit.target: This error can be caused by a bad username or password specified for the global admin account or because the global admin account specified is federated.

trans-unit.source: To fix this issue, re-run configuration with the correct username and password and ensure the administrator is a managed (cloud-only or password-sync’d) account.
trans-unit.target: To fix this issue, re-run configuration with the correct username and password and ensure the administrator is a managed (cloud-only or password-sync’d) account.

trans-unit.source: CryptoError
trans-unit.target: CryptoError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates there was an error when generating the password encryption key or decrypting a password that arrives from the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates there was an error when generating the password encryption key or decrypting a password that arrives from the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: This error likely indicates an issue with your environment.
trans-unit.target: This error likely indicates an issue with your environment.

trans-unit.source: Look at the details of your event log to learn more and resolve this issue.
trans-unit.target: Look at the details of your event log to learn more and resolve this issue.

trans-unit.source: You may also try disabling and re-enabling the Password Writeback service to resolve this.
trans-unit.target: You may also try disabling and re-enabling the Password Writeback service to resolve this.

trans-unit.source: OnBoardingServiceError
trans-unit.target: OnBoardingServiceError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that the on-premises service could not properly communicate with the password reset web service to initiate the onboarding process.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that the on-premises service could not properly communicate with the password reset web service to initiate the onboarding process.

trans-unit.source: This may be because of a firewall rule or problem getting an auth token for your tenant.
trans-unit.target: This may be because of a firewall rule or problem getting an auth token for your tenant.

trans-unit.source: To fix this, ensure that you are not blocking outbound connections over TCP 443 and TCP 9350-9354 or to https://ssprsbprodncu-sb.accesscontrol.windows.net/, and that the AAD admin account you are using to onboard is not federated.
trans-unit.target: To fix this, ensure that you are not blocking outbound connections over TCP 443 and TCP 9350-9354 or to https://ssprsbprodncu-sb.accesscontrol.windows.net/, and that the AAD admin account you are using to onboard is not federated.

trans-unit.source: OnBoardingServiceDisableError
trans-unit.target: OnBoardingServiceDisableError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: DEPRECATED – This event is not present in Azure AD Connect, only very early builds of DirSync which supported writeback.
trans-unit.target: DEPRECATED – This event is not present in Azure AD Connect, only very early builds of DirSync which supported writeback.

trans-unit.source: OffBoardingError
trans-unit.target: OffBoardingError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that the on-premises service could not properly communicate with the password reset web service to initiate the offboarding process.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that the on-premises service could not properly communicate with the password reset web service to initiate the offboarding process.

trans-unit.source: This may be because of a firewall rule or problem getting an authorization token for your tenant.
trans-unit.target: This may be because of a firewall rule or problem getting an authorization token for your tenant.

trans-unit.source: To fix this, ensure that you are not blocking outbound connections over 443 or to https://ssprsbprodncu-sb.accesscontrol.windows.net/, and that the AAD admin account you are using to offboard is not federated.
trans-unit.target: To fix this, ensure that you are not blocking outbound connections over 443 or to https://ssprsbprodncu-sb.accesscontrol.windows.net/, and that the AAD admin account you are using to offboard is not federated.

trans-unit.source: ServiceBusWarning
trans-unit.target: ServiceBusWarning

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that we had to retry to connect to your tenant’s service bus instance.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that we had to retry to connect to your tenant’s service bus instance.

trans-unit.source: Under normal conditions, this should not be a concern, but if you see this event many times, consider checking your network connection to service bus, especially if it’s a high latency or low-bandwidth connection.
trans-unit.target: Under normal conditions, this should not be a concern, but if you see this event many times, consider checking your network connection to service bus, especially if it’s a high latency or low-bandwidth connection.

trans-unit.source: ReportServiceHealthError
trans-unit.target: ReportServiceHealthError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: In order to monitor the health of your Password Writeback service, we send heartbeat data to our password reset web service every 5 minutes.
trans-unit.target: In order to monitor the health of your Password Writeback service, we send heartbeat data to our password reset web service every 5 minutes.

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that there was an error when sending this health information back to the cloud web service.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that there was an error when sending this health information back to the cloud web service.

trans-unit.source: This health information does not include an OII or PII data, and is purely a heartbeat and basic service statistics so that we can provide service status information in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: This health information does not include an OII or PII data, and is purely a heartbeat and basic service statistics so that we can provide service status information in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: ADUnKnownError
trans-unit.target: ADUnKnownError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that there was an unknown error returned by AD, check the Azure AD Connect server event log for events from the ADSync source for more information about this error.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that there was an unknown error returned by AD, check the Azure AD Connect server event log for events from the ADSync source for more information about this error.

trans-unit.source: ADUserNotFoundError
trans-unit.target: ADUserNotFoundError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that the user who is trying to reset or change a password was not found in the on-premises directory.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that the user who is trying to reset or change a password was not found in the on-premises directory.

trans-unit.source: This could occur when the user has been deleted on-premises but not in the cloud, or if there is an issue with sync.
trans-unit.target: This could occur when the user has been deleted on-premises but not in the cloud, or if there is an issue with sync.

trans-unit.source: Check your sync logs, as well as the last few sync run details for more information.
trans-unit.target: Check your sync logs, as well as the last few sync run details for more information.

trans-unit.source: ADMutliMatchError
trans-unit.target: ADMutliMatchError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: When a password reset or change request originates from the cloud, we use the cloud anchor specified during the setup process of Azure AD Connect to determine how to link that request back to a user in your on-premises environment.
trans-unit.target: When a password reset or change request originates from the cloud, we use the cloud anchor specified during the setup process of Azure AD Connect to determine how to link that request back to a user in your on-premises environment.

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that we found two users in your on-premises directory with the same cloud anchor attribute.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that we found two users in your on-premises directory with the same cloud anchor attribute.

trans-unit.source: Check your sync logs, as well as the last few sync run details for more information.
trans-unit.target: Check your sync logs, as well as the last few sync run details for more information.

trans-unit.source: ADPermissionsError
trans-unit.target: ADPermissionsError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that the Management Agent service account does not have the appropriate permissions on the account in question to set a new password.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that the Management Agent service account does not have the appropriate permissions on the account in question to set a new password.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the MA account in the user’s forest has Reset and Change password permissions on all objects in the forest.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the MA account in the user’s forest has Reset and Change password permissions on all objects in the forest.

trans-unit.source: For more information on how do to this, see Step 4: Set up the appropriate Active Directory permissions.
trans-unit.target: For more information on how do to this, see Step 4: Set up the appropriate Active Directory permissions.

trans-unit.source: ADUserAccountDisabled
trans-unit.target: ADUserAccountDisabled

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that we attempted to reset or change a password for an account that was disabled on premises.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that we attempted to reset or change a password for an account that was disabled on premises.

trans-unit.source: Enable the account and try the operation again.
trans-unit.target: Enable the account and try the operation again.

trans-unit.source: ADUserAccountLockedOut
trans-unit.target: ADUserAccountLockedOut

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: Event indicates that we attempted to reset or change a password for an account that was locked out on premises.
trans-unit.target: Event indicates that we attempted to reset or change a password for an account that was locked out on premises.

trans-unit.source: Lockouts can occur when a user has tried a change or reset password operation too many times in a short period.
trans-unit.target: Lockouts can occur when a user has tried a change or reset password operation too many times in a short period.

trans-unit.source: Unlock the account and try the operation again.
trans-unit.target: Unlock the account and try the operation again.

trans-unit.source: ADUserIncorrectPassword
trans-unit.target: ADUserIncorrectPassword

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that the user specified an incorrect current password when performing a password change operation.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that the user specified an incorrect current password when performing a password change operation.

trans-unit.source: Specify the correct current password and try again.
trans-unit.target: Specify the correct current password and try again.

trans-unit.source: ADPasswordPolicyError
trans-unit.target: ADPasswordPolicyError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event occurs when the Password Writeback service attempts to set a password on your local directory which does not meet the password age, history, complexity, or filtering requirements of the domain.
trans-unit.target: This event occurs when the Password Writeback service attempts to set a password on your local directory which does not meet the password age, history, complexity, or filtering requirements of the domain.

trans-unit.source: ADConfigurationError
trans-unit.target: ADConfigurationError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: This event indicates there was an issue writing a password back to your on-premises directory due to a configuration issue with Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates there was an issue writing a password back to your on-premises directory due to a configuration issue with Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Check the Azure AD Connect machine’s Application event log for messages from the ADSync service for more information on what error occurred.
trans-unit.target: Check the Azure AD Connect machine’s Application event log for messages from the ADSync service for more information on what error occurred.

trans-unit.source: ADPasswordPolicyOrPermissionError
trans-unit.target: ADPasswordPolicyOrPermissionError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: DEPRECATED – This event is not present in Azure AD Connect, only very early builds of DirSync which supported writeback.
trans-unit.target: DEPRECATED – This event is not present in Azure AD Connect, only very early builds of DirSync which supported writeback.

trans-unit.source: ADNotReachableError
trans-unit.target: ADNotReachableError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: DEPRECATED – This event is not present in Azure AD Connect, only very early builds of DirSync which supported writeback.
trans-unit.target: DEPRECATED – This event is not present in Azure AD Connect, only very early builds of DirSync which supported writeback.

trans-unit.source: ADInvalidAnchorError
trans-unit.target: ADInvalidAnchorError

trans-unit.source: PasswordResetService
trans-unit.target: PasswordResetService

trans-unit.source: DEPRECATED – This event is not present in Azure AD Connect, only very early builds of DirSync which supported writeback.
trans-unit.target: DEPRECATED – This event is not present in Azure AD Connect, only very early builds of DirSync which supported writeback.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot Password Writeback connectivity
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot Password Writeback connectivity

trans-unit.source: If you are experiencing service interruptions with the Password Writeback component of Azure AD Connect, here are some quick steps you can take to resolve this:
trans-unit.target: If you are experiencing service interruptions with the Password Writeback component of Azure AD Connect, here are some quick steps you can take to resolve this:

trans-unit.source: Restart the Azure AD Connect Sync Service
trans-unit.target: Restart the Azure AD Connect Sync Service

trans-unit.source: Disable and re-enable the Password Writeback feature
trans-unit.target: Disable and re-enable the Password Writeback feature

trans-unit.source: Install the latest Azure AD Connect release
trans-unit.target: Install the latest Azure AD Connect release

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot Password Writeback
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot Password Writeback

trans-unit.source: In general, we recommend that you execute these steps in the order above in order to recover your service in the most rapid manner.
trans-unit.target: In general, we recommend that you execute these steps in the order above in order to recover your service in the most rapid manner.

trans-unit.source: Restart the Azure AD Connect Sync Service
trans-unit.target: Restart the Azure AD Connect Sync Service

trans-unit.source: Restarting the Azure AD Connect Sync Service can help to resolve connectivity issues or other transient issues with the service.
trans-unit.target: Restarting the Azure AD Connect Sync Service can help to resolve connectivity issues or other transient issues with the service.

trans-unit.source: As an administrator, click **Start** on the server running **Azure AD Connect**.
trans-unit.target: As an administrator, click **Start** on the server running **Azure AD Connect**.

trans-unit.source: Type **“services.msc”** in the search box and press **Enter**.
trans-unit.target: Type **“services.msc”** in the search box and press **Enter**.

trans-unit.source: Look for the **Microsoft Azure AD Connect** entry.
trans-unit.target: Look for the **Microsoft Azure AD Connect** entry.

trans-unit.source: Right-click on the service entry, click **Restart**, and wait for the operation to complete.
trans-unit.target: Right-click on the service entry, click **Restart**, and wait for the operation to complete.

trans-unit.source: These steps will re-establish your connection with the cloud service and resolve any interruptions you may be experiencing.
trans-unit.target: These steps will re-establish your connection with the cloud service and resolve any interruptions you may be experiencing.

trans-unit.source: If restarting the Sync Service does not resolve your issue, we recommend that you try to disable and re-enable the Password Writeback feature as a next step.
trans-unit.target: If restarting the Sync Service does not resolve your issue, we recommend that you try to disable and re-enable the Password Writeback feature as a next step.

trans-unit.source: Disable and re-enable the Password Writeback feature
trans-unit.target: Disable and re-enable the Password Writeback feature

trans-unit.source: Disabling and re-enabling the Password Writeback feature can help to resolve connectivity issues.
trans-unit.target: Disabling and re-enabling the Password Writeback feature can help to resolve connectivity issues.

trans-unit.source: As an administrator, open the **Azure AD Connect configuration wizard**.
trans-unit.target: As an administrator, open the **Azure AD Connect configuration wizard**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Connect to Azure AD** dialog, enter your **Azure AD global admin credentials**
trans-unit.target: On the **Connect to Azure AD** dialog, enter your **Azure AD global admin credentials**

trans-unit.source: On the **Connect to AD DS** dialog, enter your **AD Domain Services admin credentials**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Connect to AD DS** dialog, enter your **AD Domain Services admin credentials**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Uniquely identifying your users** dialog, click the **Next** button.
trans-unit.target: On the **Uniquely identifying your users** dialog, click the **Next** button.

trans-unit.source: On the **Optional features** dialog, uncheck the **Password write-back** checkbox.
trans-unit.target: On the **Optional features** dialog, uncheck the **Password write-back** checkbox.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next** through the remaining dialog pages without changing anything until you get to the **Ready to configure** page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next** through the remaining dialog pages without changing anything until you get to the **Ready to configure** page.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the configure page shows the **Password write-back option as disabled** and then click the green **Configure** button to commit your changes.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the configure page shows the **Password write-back option as disabled** and then click the green **Configure** button to commit your changes.

trans-unit.source: On the **Finished** dialog, deselect the **Synchronize now** option, and then click **Finish** to close the wizard.
trans-unit.target: On the **Finished** dialog, deselect the **Synchronize now** option, and then click **Finish** to close the wizard.

trans-unit.source: Re-open the **Azure AD Connect configuration wizard**.
trans-unit.target: Re-open the **Azure AD Connect configuration wizard**.

trans-unit.source: **Repeat steps 2-8**, except ensure you **check the Password write-back option** on the **Optional features** screen to re-enable the service.
trans-unit.target: **Repeat steps 2-8**, except ensure you **check the Password write-back option** on the **Optional features** screen to re-enable the service.

trans-unit.source: These steps will re-establish your connection with our cloud service and resolve any interruptions you may be experiencing.
trans-unit.target: These steps will re-establish your connection with our cloud service and resolve any interruptions you may be experiencing.

trans-unit.source: If disabling and re-enabling the Password Writeback feature does not resolve your issue, we recommend that you try to re-install Azure AD Connect as a next step.
trans-unit.target: If disabling and re-enabling the Password Writeback feature does not resolve your issue, we recommend that you try to re-install Azure AD Connect as a next step.

trans-unit.source: Install the latest Azure AD Connect release
trans-unit.target: Install the latest Azure AD Connect release

trans-unit.source: Re-installing the Azure AD Connect package will resolve any configuration issues which may be affecting your ability to either connect to our cloud services or to manage passwords in your local AD environment.
trans-unit.target: Re-installing the Azure AD Connect package will resolve any configuration issues which may be affecting your ability to either connect to our cloud services or to manage passwords in your local AD environment.

trans-unit.source: We recommend, you perform this step only after attempting the first two steps described above.
trans-unit.target: We recommend, you perform this step only after attempting the first two steps described above.

trans-unit.source: Download the latest version of Azure AD Connect [here](active-directory-aadconnect.md#download-azure-ad-connect).
trans-unit.target: Download the latest version of Azure AD Connect [here](active-directory-aadconnect.md#download-azure-ad-connect).

trans-unit.source: Since you have already installed Azure AD Connect, you will only need to perform an in-place upgrade to update your Azure AD Connect installation to the latest version.
trans-unit.target: Since you have already installed Azure AD Connect, you will only need to perform an in-place upgrade to update your Azure AD Connect installation to the latest version.

trans-unit.source: Execute the downloaded package and follow the on-screen instructions to update your Azure AD Connect machine.
trans-unit.target: Execute the downloaded package and follow the on-screen instructions to update your Azure AD Connect machine.

trans-unit.source: No additional manual steps are required unless you have customized the out of box sync rules, in which case you should **back these up before proceeding with upgrade and manually re-deploy them after you are finished**.
trans-unit.target: No additional manual steps are required unless you have customized the out of box sync rules, in which case you should **back these up before proceeding with upgrade and manually re-deploy them after you are finished**.

trans-unit.source: These steps will re-establish your connection with our cloud service and resolve any interruptions you may be experiencing.
trans-unit.target: These steps will re-establish your connection with our cloud service and resolve any interruptions you may be experiencing.

trans-unit.source: If installing the latest version of the Azure AD Connect server does not resolve your issue, we recommend that you try disabling and re-enabling Password Writeback as a final step after installing the latest sync QFE.
trans-unit.target: If installing the latest version of the Azure AD Connect server does not resolve your issue, we recommend that you try disabling and re-enabling Password Writeback as a final step after installing the latest sync QFE.

trans-unit.source: If that does not resolve your issue, then we recommend that you take a look at [Troubleshoot Password Writeback](#troubleshoot-password-writeback) and the [Azure AD password Management FAQ](active-directory-passwords-faq.md) to see if your issue may be discussed there.
trans-unit.target: If that does not resolve your issue, then we recommend that you take a look at [Troubleshoot Password Writeback](#troubleshoot-password-writeback) and the [Azure AD password Management FAQ](active-directory-passwords-faq.md) to see if your issue may be discussed there.
